<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning,</strong> and welcome to 2021. Wow, even saying that doesn't feel real. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We've got a lot of big dreams for the new year, particularly remembering how to write the date correctly before spring. But there's also a lot to think about in terms of moving forward from everything that happened in 2020. So today, to wrap up the Brew's special year-end series, I’m diving into what's next. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<a href="https://twitter.com/its_ahickey" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alex Hickey</a></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/01/build-back-better-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Building Back Better
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A young girl and a young boy cleaning dirt off a world map mural. She is standing on a ladder and he is standing on the ground. South Africa, August 2019." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTY0L2NsZWFuaW5nX2dsb2JlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that Christmas trees are littering street corners and the champagne's run out, it feels like the right time to think about what's next and how we climb out of this pandemic. Which brings us to rule No. 1 of any successful plan: You need a catchphrase. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This summer, the winner for the Covid recovery slogan competition was <strong style="color:#000">Build Back Better</strong>. You might remember Triple-B from when Joe Biden adopted it as his campaign slogan. Or when it was taken up by leaders in the UK, New Zealand, and Scotland, as well as other organizations around the world. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If this was high school English, they'd all flunk for plagiarism. "Building Back Better" was adopted as part of the United Nations' Sendai Framework for disaster recovery in 2015. The basic idea is using a disaster like a tsunami as an opportunity to build back with more resilient infrastructure, better preparations, and a more equitable society.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">We have a lot of building to do </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starting with the obvious: <strong style="color:#000">pandemic preparedness, </strong>which moved from the government's "nice-to-have" to "we need this more than a premium Zoom account” list. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/05/17/the-art-of-the-pandemic-how-donald-trump-walked-the-u-s-into-the-covid-19-era/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no</a> <a href="https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/obama-team-left-pandemic-playbook-for-trump-administration-officials-confirm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shortage</a> <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/25/trump-coronavirus-national-security-council-149285?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">of</a> <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2020/04/11/america-two-decade-failure-prepare-coronavirus-179574?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a> <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/national-security/clinton-trump-20-years-boom-mostly-bust-prepping-pandemics-n1182291?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about</a> how pandemic game plans were weakened before Covid arrived on American shores, and how a lack of to-do lists, institutional knowledge, and scientific leadership factored into the severity of the U.S.' early outbreaks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Step 1 to building back better: </strong>Do the opposite of whatever that was. Experts have recommended that Biden (and future presidents) strengthen the President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology and the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy. The Oval Office can't coordinate everything, but it does need to coordinate. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Agencies </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/to-prepare-for-the-next-pandemic-the-us-needs-to-change-its-national-security-priorities-experts-say/2020/06/16/b99807c0-aa9a-11ea-9063-e69bd6520940_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">involved</a></span><span> in the coronavirus response, including the CDC, DHHS, and DHS, weren't always keeping up with the group text. The White House needs a designated leader to coordinate cross-government action and communication with states and cities. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Speaking of, it also needs a clear framework for federal, state, and local governments’ responsibilities. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Step 2: </strong>Spend money. States may need their own pandemic budgets. The CDC needs to be better equipped for tasks like setting up national testing and tracing. Federal, state, and hospital stockpiles need some topping off. Whoever makes vaccines needs a raise.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The WHO's Global Preparedness Monitoring Board estimates that good pandemic preparedness investments would cost $5/person </span><span><a href="https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AR_2020_EN.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">annually</a></span><span>. "It would take 500 years to spend as much on investing in preparedness as the world is losing due to Covid,” the board writes. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Step 3:</strong> Make sure your friends stay friends. The Council on Foreign Relations <a href="https://www.cfr.org/report/pandemic-preparedness-lessons-COVID-19/recommendations/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recommends</a> that the U.S. remain in the WHO. Though it’s a flawed institution, the council argues, it's the best multilateral body to coordinate international action, aid, and accountability. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Also make frenemies. "We will have to work with China," former diplomat Nicholas Burns told the WaPo. "Our political leaders have a responsibility to compete, but in a smart way and not drive this relationship into a ditch."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Step 4: </strong>Untangle the supply chain. Covid-19 exposed our dependence on China for critical medical supplies (along with other goods) and showed that global supply chains have <a href="https://www.mckinsey.com/business-functions/operations/our-insights/covid-19-and-supply-chain-recovery-planning-for-the-future?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">become increasingly complex</a> without becoming more resilient. Supply chains "were designed for cost and efficiency, but without really a thought to what could go wrong along the way," per McKinsey partner Susan Lund.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Great, now we're prepared for the next health crisis. But how do we emerge stronger from the current economic crisis? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It should equitable</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pandemic highlighted the racial inequalities present in American society. Black and Hispanic or Latino workers have been <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/research/rebuild-better-a-framework-to-support-an-equitable-recovery-from-covid-19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more likely</a> to lose their jobs and to serve as essential workers in frontline, low-wage roles. And Black, Hispanic, and Latino business owners were less likely to get CARES Act funds.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To build back better, more efforts are needed to address racial and class disparities in the recovery itself. You might have heard of the "<a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/k-shaped-recovery-definition?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">K-shaped recovery</a>," in which wealthier Americans generally rebounded while those at the bottom have been left even farther behind.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To turn that K into a Nike swoosh, the U.S. needs to address the historical disinvestment that has left some communities and groups of workers behind. Aid should be progressive to help lift the most vulnerable and impacted, according to the OECD. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some areas to start:</strong> Unemployment benefit programs, paid sick leave, food assistance programs, <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/research/why-main-streets-are-a-key-driver-of-equitable-economic-recovery-in-rural-america/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rural economic development</a>, broadband access to allow more workers to participate in the remote work revolution, and <a href="https://jfforg-prod-new.s3.amazonaws.com/media/documents/Recommendations_Chart_VFBiden.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">programs</a> to train or reskill workers at the local level. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Harvard economic policy professor Jason Furman </span><span><a href="https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/united-states/2020-11-30/biden-build-back-better-economy?utm_medium=social&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggests</a></span><span> tying future responses to improvements in economic indicators (instead of arbitrary timeframes) so that assistance scales up or down depending on how much we need it. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The recovery also needs to be green</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The climate clock is ticking down, and the brief dip in emissions from the pandemic's shutdowns is bouncing back.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An equitable and successful economic recovery can <a href="https://www.oecd.org/coronavirus/policy-responses/building-back-better-a-sustainable-resilient-recovery-after-covid-19-52b869f5/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">align with other long-term needs</a> for a sustainable future, such as reducing emissions, protecting biodiversity, creating more circular supply chains, and generating jobs in new industries. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The government's "most effective tool" for the latter is increasing infrastructure investment, Furman said. The Biden administration has promised $2 trillion in infrastructure spending that it says will create 10 million jobs tied to clean energy.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Full circle: </strong>Climate change is also linked to pandemic preparedness. "The economic pressures driving biodiversity loss and the destruction of ocean health can have cascading impacts on societies, and may increase the risk of future zoonotic viruses (those which jump from animals to humans)," the OECD writes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Covid-19 has arrived during a <a href="https://www.mckinsey.com/featured-insights/long-term-capitalism/rethinking-the-future-of-american-capitalism?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pivotal moment</a> for American capitalism. Tying together all these ways we could improve—healthcare, access and equity, infrastructure—"is the need for urgent decisions taken today to incorporate a longer-term perspective," the OECD writes.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Usually our upstairs neighbor—we’ll call him Bart—keeps us up at night with his noisy shenanigans. But Bart’s no match for our <a href="https://www.bose.com/en_us/products/wellness/noise_masking_sleepbuds/noise-masking-sleepbuds-ii.html?mc=25_CE_QE_GM_00_M2_MB101" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bose Sleepbuds™ II</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bose Sleepbuds™ II are tiny, wireless earbuds, designed specifically to give you a great night's sleep.</strong> They work with the Bose Sleep app to deliver <a href="https://www.bose.com/en_us/products/wellness/noise_masking_sleepbuds/noise-masking-sleepbuds-ii.html?mc=25_CE_QE_GM_00_M2_MB101" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relaxing sounds that help you wind down, fall asleep, and stay asleep</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So while Bart fails to learn a Bach concerto, we are lost in dreamland. And when his pet billy goat (also named Bart) gallops around his apartment, <a href="https://www.bose.com/en_us/products/wellness/noise_masking_sleepbuds/noise-masking-sleepbuds-ii.html?mc=25_CE_QE_GM_00_M2_MB101" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we’re falling asleep to soothing sounds with the Bose Sleep app</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Basically these Sleepbuds are a Bart Buffer that will have you be noise-free, stress-free, and sleep-full.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.bose.com/en_us/products/wellness/noise_masking_sleepbuds/noise-masking-sleepbuds-ii.html?mc=25_CE_QE_GM_00_M2_MB101" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get your best night’s sleep with Bose Sleepbuds™ II today</a>. </p>

IMAGE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Snapshot from 2020
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Twenty thousand chairs, each representing 1,000 deaths from the coronavirus pandemic in the United States are lined up on the Ellipse for the first National COVID-19 Remembrance October 04, 2020 in Washington, DC. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTg1L2NvdmlkLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Katherine Frey/The Washington Post via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Oct. 4, 20,000 chairs were laid out on D.C.'s National Mall to remember the then-200,000 lives lost in the U.S. from the coronavirus. Today, they'd need over 50% more chairs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the strangest parts of 2020, and there have been a lot, has been the lack of a time and place to collectively mourn. As optimistic as I am entering 2021, this image will stick with me as a reminder of all the people that won't head into the new year with us.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
Q&A
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/01/behind-brew-alex-hickey?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Behind the Brew: Alex Hickey
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hometown: </strong>Heidelberg, Germany</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What you would be doing if not writing for the Brew: </strong>If I'm being realistic, probably working on the Hill wondering why I'm getting paid peanuts. If I'm being idealistic, foreign service.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One thing you are snobby about: </strong>Baking chocolate. My happy place is the kitchen, but if you show up with some Hershey's morsels, things will go downhill real fast. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">First R-rated movie: </strong>Not sure I ever graduated past PG-13…but there is a decent chance my first R-rated flick was <em>Love, Actually</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is something fun you did that you'd never do again? </strong>Bungee jumping off a bridge in the Italian Alps. It was a memorable experience, but it doesn't hold a candle to skydiving and I don't recommend engaging in death-defying activities when there's a language barrier. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">If you could safely eat any inedible object, what would it be? </strong>Ever been in a Lush store? Everything in there looks like dessert. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Recommend literally anything: </strong>I'll never stop plugging<a href="https://www.amazon.com/Anker-Wireless-Vertical-Ergonomic-Optical/dp/B00BIFNTMC?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"> Anker's ergonomic wireless mouse</a>. It's an absolute game-changer. I also curate<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"> Brew's Bookshelf</a> on the side, so if you're ever on the hunt for a good read, check it out.</p>

style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGOVERNMENT\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/01/build-back-better-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBuilding Back Better\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A young girl and a young boy cleaning dirt off a world map mural. She is standing on a ladder and he is standing on the ground. South Africa, August 2019.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTY0L2NsZWFuaW5nX2dsb2JlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow that Christmas trees are littering street corners and the champagne's run out, it feels like the right time to think about what's next and how we climb out of this pandemic. Which brings us to rule No. 1 of any successful plan: You need a catchphrase. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis summer, the winner for the Covid recovery slogan competition was \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBuild Back Better\u003c/strong\u003e. You might remember Triple-B from when Joe Biden adopted it as his campaign slogan. Or when it was taken up by leaders in the UK, New Zealand, and Scotland, as well as other organizations around the world. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf this was high school English, they'd all flunk for plagiarism. \"Building Back Better\" was adopted as part of the United Nations' Sendai Framework for disaster recovery in 2015. The basic idea is using a disaster like a tsunami as an opportunity to build back with more resilient infrastructure, better preparations, and a more equitable society.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWe have a lot of building to do \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarting with the obvious: \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003epandemic preparedness, \u003c/strong\u003ewhich moved from the government's \"nice-to-have\" to \"we need this more than a premium Zoom account” list. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere's \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/05/17/the-art-of-the-pandemic-how-donald-trump-walked-the-u-s-into-the-covid-19-era/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eno\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.pbs.org/newshour/nation/obama-team-left-pandemic-playbook-for-trump-administration-officials-confirm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshortage\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/25/trump-coronavirus-national-security-council-149285?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eof\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2020/04/11/america-two-decade-failure-prepare-coronavirus-179574?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/national-security/clinton-trump-20-years-boom-mostly-bust-prepping-pandemics-n1182291?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout\u003c/a\u003e how pandemic game plans were weakened before Covid arrived on American shores, and how a lack of to-do lists, institutional knowledge, and scientific leadership factored into the severity of the U.S.' early outbreaks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStep 1 to building back better: \u003c/strong\u003eDo the opposite of whatever that was. Experts have recommended that Biden (and future presidents) strengthen the President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology and the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy. The Oval Office can't coordinate everything, but it does need to coordinate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAgencies \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/to-prepare-for-the-next-pandemic-the-us-needs-to-change-its-national-security-priorities-experts-say/2020/06/16/b99807c0-aa9a-11ea-9063-e69bd6520940_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvolved\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the coronavirus response, including the CDC, DHHS, and DHS, weren't always keeping up with the group text. The White House needs a designated leader to coordinate cross-government action and communication with states and cities. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpeaking of, it also needs a clear framework for federal, state, and local governments’ responsibilities. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStep 2: \u003c/strong\u003eSpend money. States may need their own pandemic budgets. The CDC needs to be better equipped for tasks like setting up national testing and tracing. Federal, state, and hospital stockpiles need some topping off. Whoever makes vaccines needs a raise.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe WHO's Global Preparedness Monitoring Board estimates that good pandemic preparedness investments would cost $5/person \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apps.who.int/gpmb/assets/annual_report/GPMB_AR_2020_EN.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannually\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \"It would take 500 years to spend as much on investing in preparedness as the world is losing due to Covid,” the board writes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStep 3:\u003c/strong\u003e Make sure your friends stay friends. The Council on Foreign Relations \u003ca href=\"https://www.cfr.org/report/pandemic-preparedness-lessons-COVID-19/recommendations/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecommends\u003c/a\u003e that the U.S. remain in the WHO. Though it’s a flawed institution, the council argues, it's the best multilateral body to coordinate international action, aid, and accountability. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlso make frenemies. \"We will have to work with China,\" former diplomat Nicholas Burns told the WaPo. \"Our political leaders have a responsibility to compete, but in a smart way and not drive this relationship into a ditch.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStep 4: \u003c/strong\u003eUntangle the supply chain. Covid-19 exposed our dependence on China for critical medical supplies (along with other goods) and showed that global supply chains have \u003ca href=\"https://www.mckinsey.com/business-functions/operations/our-insights/covid-19-and-supply-chain-recovery-planning-for-the-future?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecome increasingly complex\u003c/a\u003e without becoming more resilient. Supply chains \"were designed for cost and efficiency, but without really a thought to what could go wrong along the way,\" per McKinsey partner Susan Lund.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGreat, now we're prepared for the next health crisis. But how do we emerge stronger from the current economic crisis? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt should equitable\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pandemic highlighted the racial inequalities present in American society. Black and Hispanic or Latino workers have been \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/research/rebuild-better-a-framework-to-support-an-equitable-recovery-from-covid-19/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore likely\u003c/a\u003e to lose their jobs and to serve as essential workers in frontline, low-wage roles. And Black, Hispanic, and Latino business owners were less likely to get CARES Act funds.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo build back better, more efforts are needed to address racial and class disparities in the recovery itself. You might have heard of the \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/k-shaped-recovery-definition?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eK-shaped recovery\u003c/a\u003e,\" in which wealthier Americans generally rebounded while those at the bottom have been left even farther behind.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo turn that K into a Nike swoosh, the U.S. needs to address the historical disinvestment that has left some communities and groups of workers behind. Aid should be progressive to help lift the most vulnerable and impacted, according to the OECD. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome areas to start:\u003c/strong\u003e Unemployment benefit programs, paid sick leave, food assistance programs, \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/research/why-main-streets-are-a-key-driver-of-equitable-economic-recovery-in-rural-america/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erural economic development\u003c/a\u003e, broadband access to allow more workers to participate in the remote work revolution, and \u003ca href=\"https://jfforg-prod-new.s3.amazonaws.com/media/documents/Recommendations_Chart_VFBiden.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprograms\u003c/a\u003e to train or reskill workers at the local level. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHarvard economic policy professor Jason Furman \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/united-states/2020-11-30/biden-build-back-better-economy?utm_medium=social\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggests\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e tying future responses to improvements in economic indicators (instead of arbitrary timeframes) so that assistance scales up or down depending on how much we need it. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe recovery also needs to be green\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe climate clock is ticking down, and the brief dip in emissions from the pandemic's shutdowns is bouncing back.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn equitable and successful economic recovery can \u003ca href=\"https://www.oecd.org/coronavirus/policy-responses/building-back-better-a-sustainable-resilient-recovery-after-covid-19-52b869f5/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealign with other long-term needs\u003c/a\u003e for a sustainable future, such as reducing emissions, protecting biodiversity, creating more circular supply chains, and generating jobs in new industries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe government's \"most effective tool\" for the latter is increasing infrastructure investment, Furman said. The Biden administration has promised $2 trillion in infrastructure spending that it says will create 10 million jobs tied to clean energy.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFull circle: \u003c/strong\u003eClimate change is also linked to pandemic preparedness. \"The economic pressures driving biodiversity loss and the destruction of ocean health can have cascading impacts on societies, and may increase the risk of future zoonotic viruses (those which jump from animals to humans),\" the OECD writes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Covid-19 has arrived during a \u003ca href=\"https://www.mckinsey.com/featured-insights/long-term-capitalism/rethinking-the-future-of-american-capitalism?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epivotal moment\u003c/a\u003e for American capitalism. Tying together all these ways we could improve—healthcare, access and equity, infrastructure—\"is the need for urgent decisions taken today to incorporate a longer-term perspective,\" the OECD style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHometown: \u003c/strong\u003eHeidelberg, Germany\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat you would be doing if not writing for the Brew: \u003c/strong\u003eIf I'm being realistic, probably working on the Hill wondering why I'm getting paid peanuts. If I'm being idealistic, foreign service.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne thing you are snobby about: \u003c/strong\u003eBaking chocolate. My happy place is the kitchen, but if you show up with some Hershey's morsels, things will go downhill real fast. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFirst R-rated movie: \u003c/strong\u003eNot sure I ever graduated past PG-13…but there is a decent chance my first R-rated flick was \u003cem\u003eLove, Actually\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is something fun you did that you'd never do again? \u003c/strong\u003eBungee jumping off a bridge in the Italian Alps. It was a memorable experience, but it doesn't hold a candle to skydiving and I don't recommend engaging in death-defying activities when there's a language barrier. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIf you could safely eat any inedible object, what would it be? \u003c/strong\u003eEver been in a Lush store? Everything in there looks like dessert. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRecommend literally anything: \u003c/strong\u003eI'll never stop plugging\u003ca href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Anker-Wireless-Vertical-Ergonomic-Optical/dp/B00BIFNTMC?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e Anker's ergonomic wireless mouse\u003c/a\u003e. It's an absolute game-changer. I also curate\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e Brew's Bookshelf\u003c/a\u003e on the side, so if you're ever on the hunt for a good read, check it out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F01%2F01%2Fbehind-brew-alex-hickey\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
